canonical_explanation.text: Two quantities are in direct proportion if an increase in one causes a proportional increase in the other (x/y = constant). Two quantities are in inverse proportion if an increase in one causes a proportional decrease in the other (x * y = constant). These concepts are used to solve problems involving speed-time, work-workers, cost-quantity relationships.
rules: Direct proportion: x1/y1 = x2/y2 (or x1*y2 = x2*y1)
Inverse proportion: x1 * y1 = x2 * y2
More quantity → more cost (direct), More workers → less time (inverse)
If x and y are in direct proportion, their graph passes through the origin

questions.question_text: If 5 kg of rice costs Rs 200, what is the cost of 8 kg of rice?
questions.explanation_correct: Cost and quantity are in direct proportion. 5/200 = 8/x. x = (200 x 8)/5 = Rs 320.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cost per kg = 200/5 = Rs 40. Cost of 8 kg = 40 x 8 = Rs 320.

questions.question_text: If 6 workers can build a wall in 12 days, how many days will 9 workers take?
questions.explanation_correct: Workers and days are inversely proportional. 6 x 12 = 9 x d. d = 72/9 = 8 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: More workers = fewer days (inverse). 6 x 12 = 9 x d. d = 72/9 = 8 days.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of direct proportion?

options.text: Speed and time to cover a fixed distance
Number of items and total cost (at fixed rate)
Number of workers and days to complete a task
Number of pipes and time to fill a tank

questions.explanation_correct: More items bought at the same rate costs more. This is direct proportion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A, C, D are inverse proportions. Only B (items and cost at fixed rate) is direct proportion.

questions.question_text: If a car travels 150 km in 3 hours, how far will it travel in 5 hours at the same speed?
questions.explanation_correct: Distance and time are in direct proportion (at constant speed). 150/3 = x/5. x = 50 x 5 = 250 km.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Speed = 150/3 = 50 km/h. In 5 hours: 50 x 5 = 250 km.

questions.question_text: A car takes 4 hours to travel a distance at 60 km/h. How long will it take at 80 km/h?
questions.explanation_correct: Speed and time are inversely proportional (fixed distance). 60 x 4 = 80 x t. t = 240/80 = 3 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Distance = 60 x 4 = 240 km. Time at 80 km/h = 240/80 = 3 hours.

questions.question_text: If more men are employed, more time is taken to complete the work. This is an example of direct proportion.
questions.explanation_correct: More men means less time (not more). And the relationship between men and time is inverse proportion, not direct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is wrong on two counts: more men means less time, and it is inverse proportion.

questions.question_text: If 3 metres of cloth cost Rs 270, how much will 7 metres cost?
questions.explanation_correct: Direct proportion: 3/270 = 7/x. x = (270 x 7)/3 = Rs 630.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cost per metre = 270/3 = Rs 90. Cost of 7 metres = 90 x 7 = Rs 630.

questions.question_text: If 15 men can do a piece of work in 10 days, then 10 men can do it in ____ days.
questions.explanation_correct: Inverse proportion: 15 x 10 = 10 x d. d = 150/10 = 15 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Men x Days = constant. 15 x 10 = 10 x d. d = 15 days.

questions.question_text: In which of the following cases are x and y in inverse proportion?
questions.explanation_correct: Check x x y: 2x24=48, 4x12=48, 8x6=48. Constant product = 48. Inverse proportion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In B, x x y = 48 for all pairs, confirming inverse proportion. Others have constant ratios (direct).

questions.question_text: If x and y are in direct proportion with x = 4 when y = 10, find y when x = 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 4/10 = 6/y. Cross multiply: 4y = 60. y = 15.

questions.question_text: A fort has provisions for 300 soldiers for 90 days. How long will they last for 450 soldiers?
questions.explanation_correct: More soldiers = fewer days (inverse). 300 x 90 = 450 x d. d = 27000/450 = 60 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Soldiers and days are inversely proportional. 300 x 90 = 450 x d. d = 60 days.

questions.question_text: If x and y are in direct proportion, then x/y remains constant.
questions.explanation_correct: By definition, in direct proportion x/y = k (a constant). So x1/y1 = x2/y2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Direct proportion means x/y is always the same constant value.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of inverse proportion?

options.text: Distance and time at constant speed
Weight and cost of fruits at fixed rate
Speed and time to cover a fixed distance
Number of books and total cost at same price

questions.explanation_correct: For a fixed distance, higher speed means less time. Speed and time are inversely proportional.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A, B, D are direct proportions. C (speed and time for fixed distance) is inverse proportion.

questions.question_text: A map is drawn to a scale of 1 cm to 5 km. If two cities are 8 cm apart on the map, what is the actual distance?
questions.explanation_correct: Map distance and actual distance are in direct proportion. Actual = 8 x 5 = 40 km.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scale: 1 cm = 5 km. So 8 cm = 8 x 5 = 40 km.

questions.question_text: If x and y are inversely proportional with x = 3 when y = 12, find y when x = 4.
questions.explanation_correct: xy = constant. 3 x 12 = 4 x y. y = 36/4 = 9.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Inverse proportion: x1 x y1 = x2 x y2. 36 = 4y. y = 9.

questions.question_text: The number of hours to complete a task and the number of workers are in ____ proportion.
questions.explanation_correct: More workers means fewer hours. Workers x Hours = constant. This is inverse proportion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: As workers increase, time decreases. This is inverse proportion.

questions.question_text: If 12 notebooks cost Rs 360, how many notebooks can be bought for Rs 600?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cost per notebook = 360/12 = Rs 30. Notebooks for 600 = 600/30 = 20.

questions.question_text: If 8 taps fill a tank in 6 hours, then 12 taps will fill it in 4 hours.
questions.explanation_correct: Inverse proportion: 8 x 6 = 12 x t. t = 48/12 = 4 hours. The statement is correct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Taps and time are inversely proportional. 8 x 6 = 48 = 12 x 4. So 12 taps take 4 hours.

questions.question_text: A recipe requires 2 cups of flour to make 12 cookies. How many cups are needed for 30 cookies?
questions.explanation_correct: Direct proportion: 2/12 = x/30. x = (2 x 30)/12 = 60/12 = 5 cups.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Flour and cookies are directly proportional. 2/12 = x/30. x = 5 cups.

questions.question_text: Which statement correctly identifies the type of proportion? 'If the number of days increases, the daily wages earned increase.'
questions.explanation_correct: More days worked means more wages (at a fixed daily rate). This is direct proportion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wages increase as days increase. This is direct proportion.

questions.question_text: A machine fills 420 bottles in 6 hours. How many bottles can it fill in 10 hours?
questions.explanation_correct: Direct proportion: 420/6 = x/10. x = 70 x 10 = 700 bottles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rate = 420/6 = 70 bottles/hour. In 10 hours = 70 x 10 = 700.

questions.question_text: 18 workers can harvest a field in 8 days. How many workers are needed to harvest it in 6 days?
questions.explanation_correct: Inverse proportion: 18 x 8 = w x 6. w = 144/6 = 24 workers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Workers x Days = constant. 18 x 8 = 6w. w = 144/6 = 24.

questions.question_text: If 8 men can earn Rs 12,000 in 15 days, how much will 10 men earn in 15 days?
questions.explanation_correct: Same number of days, more men earn more. Direct proportion: 8/12000 = 10/x. x = (12000 x 10)/8 = Rs 15,000.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Earning per man = 12000/8 = Rs 1500. For 10 men = 10 x 1500 = Rs 15,000.

questions.question_text: A garrison of 500 men had provisions for 24 days. After 4 days, a reinforcement of 300 men arrives. For how many more days will the food last?
questions.explanation_correct: Food consumed in 4 days for 500 men = 4 days' worth. Remaining food = for 500 men for 20 days. Now 800 men: 500 x 20 = 800 x d. d = 10000/800 = 12.5 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: After 4 days: food for 500 men for 20 days remains. Now 800 men eat it: 500 x 20 = 800d. d = 12.5 days.

questions.question_text: x and y are related as follows: x = 2, y = 18; x = 3, y = 12; x = 6, y = 6. What type of proportion is this?
questions.explanation_correct: Check product: 2x18=36, 3x12=36, 6x6=36. xy is constant, so inverse proportion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: xy = 36 for all pairs. Constant product means inverse proportion.

questions.question_text: If the weight of 10 sheets of paper is 40 grams, then the weight of 25 sheets is ____ grams.
questions.explanation_correct: Direct proportion: 10/40 = 25/x. x = (40 x 25)/10 = 100 grams.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Weight per sheet = 40/10 = 4 g. Weight of 25 sheets = 25 x 4 = 100 g.

questions.question_text: A train running at 72 km/h crosses a pole in 15 seconds. How long will it take at 90 km/h?
questions.explanation_correct: Length of train is fixed. Speed and time are inversely proportional. 72 x 15 = 90 x t. t = 1080/90 = 12 seconds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fixed distance: speed x time = constant. 72 x 15 = 90 x t. t = 12 seconds.

questions.question_text: On a map with scale 1:50,000, a forest area is represented by 6 cm². What is the actual area?
questions.explanation_correct: Scale 1:50,000 means 1 cm = 0.5 km. Area scale: 1 cm² = 0.25 km². Actual area = 6 x 0.25 = 1.5 km².

questions.question_text: The cost of 7 pencils is Rs 35. Find the cost of 11 pencils. What proportion is involved?
questions.explanation_correct: More pencils cost more (direct). Cost per pencil = 35/7 = Rs 5. Cost of 11 = 5 x 11 = Rs 55.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Number and cost are directly proportional. Cost = (35/7) x 11 = Rs 55.

questions.question_text: A pipe can fill a tank in 20 minutes. 4 such pipes can fill it in:
questions.explanation_correct: More pipes = less time (inverse). 1 x 20 = 4 x t. t = 20/4 = 5 minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pipes and time: inverse proportion. 1 x 20 = 4 x t. t = 5 minutes.

questions.question_text: If 6 litres of milk costs Rs 300, then 10 litres costs Rs 400.
questions.explanation_correct: Direct proportion: Cost of 10 litres = (300/6) x 10 = 50 x 10 = Rs 500, not 400.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cost per litre = 300/6 = Rs 50. Cost of 10 litres = 50 x 10 = Rs 500.

questions.question_text: 35 cows can graze a field in 12 days. How many cows can graze the same field in 15 days?
questions.explanation_correct: Inverse proportion: 35 x 12 = c x 15. c = 420/15 = 28 cows.
questions.explanation_incorrect: More days = fewer cows needed. 35 x 12 = 15c. c = 28.

questions.question_text: If x varies directly as y, and x = 15 when y = 9, then x = 25 when y = ____.
An iron rod 1.5 m long weighs 6 kg. What is the weight of a similar rod that is 3.5 m long?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Weight per metre = 6/1.5 = 4 kg/m. Weight of 3.5 m = 4 x 3.5 = 14 kg.

questions.question_text: A school bus takes 40 minutes when travelling at 30 km/h. If the speed is increased to 40 km/h, the time taken is:
questions.explanation_correct: Speed and time are inversely proportional. 30 x 40 = 40 x t. t = 1200/40 = 30 minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fixed distance: 30 x 40 = 40 x t. t = 30 minutes.

questions.question_text: A table shows: x: 4, 8, 12 and y: 5, 10, 15. What type of proportion is this?
questions.explanation_correct: x/y: 4/5 = 0.8, 8/10 = 0.8, 12/15 = 0.8. The ratio is constant, so direct proportion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: x/y = 4/5 for all pairs. Constant ratio means direct proportion.

questions.question_text: If the shadow of a 6 m pole is 4 m long, what is the height of a tree whose shadow is 10 m long (at the same time)?
questions.explanation_correct: Height and shadow are in direct proportion. 6/4 = h/10. h = 60/4 = 15 m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At the same time, height/shadow = constant. 6/4 = h/10. h = 15 m.

questions.question_text: If 5 pumps can empty a reservoir in 12 hours, then 10 pumps can empty it in 6 hours.
questions.explanation_correct: Inverse proportion: 5 x 12 = 10 x t. t = 60/10 = 6 hours. The statement is correct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pumps x Time = constant. 5 x 12 = 60 = 10 x 6. The statement is correct.

questions.question_text: Rakesh deposited Rs 400 in a bank for 2 years and got Rs 440. If he deposits Rs 700 for the same duration at the same rate, how much will he get?
questions.explanation_correct: Interest on 400 = 40. Direct proportion: 400/40 = 700/x. x = (40 x 700)/400 = Rs 70. Amount = 700 + 70 = Rs 770.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Interest is directly proportional to principal. Interest = 40 x 700/400 = 70. Amount = 700 + 70 = Rs 770.

questions.question_text: A factory produces 600 items in 5 days working 8 hours a day. How many items will it produce in 4 days working 10 hours a day?
questions.explanation_correct: Total hours: 5 x 8 = 40. New total: 4 x 10 = 40. Same hours, so same output = 600 items.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Items per hour = 600/40 = 15. New hours = 40. Items = 15 x 40 = 600.

questions.question_text: Which situation involves both direct and inverse proportion? '6 typists can type 480 pages in 10 days. How many typists are needed to type 600 pages in 5 days?'
questions.explanation_correct: Rate per typist per day = 480/(6 x 10) = 8 pages. For 600 pages in 5 days: need 600/(8 x 5) = 600/40 = 15 typists.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each typist types 8 pages/day. To type 600 pages in 5 days: 600/5 = 120 pages/day needed. Typists = 120/8 = 15.

questions.question_text: A photograph measuring 4 cm x 6 cm is enlarged so that the longer side becomes 18 cm. What is the length of the shorter side?
questions.explanation_correct: Enlargement is proportional. Scale factor = 18/6 = 3. Shorter side = 4 x 3 = 12 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Direct proportion: 6/4 = 18/x. x = (4 x 18)/6 = 12 cm.

questions.question_text: 12 men can dig a pond in 8 days. How many men can dig it in 6 days?
questions.explanation_correct: Inverse proportion: 12 x 8 = m x 6. m = 96/6 = 16 men.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Men x Days = constant. 12 x 8 = 6m. m = 96/6 = 16.

questions.question_text: A car travels 300 km in 5 hours. Another car travels 432 km in 6 hours. Which car is faster?
questions.explanation_correct: Speed of first = 300/5 = 60 km/h. Speed of second = 432/6 = 72 km/h. Second car is faster.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compare rates: 60 km/h vs 72 km/h. The second car is faster.

questions.question_text: If 25 people can complete a project in 20 days, then 50 people can complete it in ____ days.
questions.explanation_correct: Inverse proportion: 25 x 20 = 50 x d. d = 500/50 = 10 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Double the workers means half the time. 25 x 20 = 50d. d = 10 days.

questions.question_text: A train covers 360 km in 4 hours. If it needs to cover 540 km, how long will it take at the same speed?
questions.explanation_correct: Direct proportion (constant speed): 360/4 = 540/t. t = (4 x 540)/360 = 2160/360 = 6 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Speed = 360/4 = 90 km/h. Time for 540 km = 540/90 = 6 hours.

questions.question_text: A camp has provisions for 120 students for 15 days. If 20 more students join the camp, the provisions will last for:
questions.explanation_correct: More students = fewer days (inverse). 120 x 15 = 140 x d. d = 1800/140 = 12.86 days (approx).
questions.explanation_incorrect: New count = 140. 120 x 15 = 140d. d = 1800/140 = 90/7 = 12.86 days approximately.

questions.question_text: An army camp has provisions for 50 soldiers for 40 days. After 10 days, 10 soldiers leave. How many more days will the food last?
questions.explanation_correct: After 10 days, food remains for 50 soldiers for 30 days. Now 40 soldiers: 50 x 30 = 40 x d. d = 1500/40 = 37.5 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Remaining food = 50 soldiers x 30 days. For 40 soldiers: d = 1500/40 = 37.5 days.

questions.question_text: In a model of a ship, the mast is 9 cm high while the actual mast is 12 m high. If the deck of the actual ship is 28 m, what is the deck length in the model?
questions.explanation_correct: Scale: 9 cm represents 12 m. Direct proportion: 9/12 = x/28. x = (9 x 28)/12 = 252/12 = 21 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scale factor = 9/12 = 3/4 cm per m. Deck in model = (3/4) x 28 = 21 cm.

questions.question_text: If x and y are inversely proportional and x = 5 when y = 8, then when x = 20, y = 2.
questions.explanation_correct: xy = constant. 5 x 8 = 40. When x = 20: 20y = 40. y = 2. The statement is correct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: xy = 5 x 8 = 40. When x = 20: y = 40/20 = 2. Correct.
